entry.title: A great second article
entry.content: This is the second post or article How to change the directory name: go to the content (article) and cmd-x the title, backspace and change the directory name. Backslash and cmd-v to paste the contents name.
entry.summary: This is the second post or article How to change the directory name: go to the content (article) and cmd-x the title, backspace and change the directory name. Backslash and cmd-v to paste the contents name.

entry.title: this is the article title which does not have to be the same as the file name

link.title: this is the article title which does not have to be the same as the file name

entry.content:
Yay. Again the YAML frontmatter, that part between the 3 dashes that does not show up on the website itself, is a signal to jekkyl that you want this piece of code to be compiled to somehting on the website

This is heading two

The date and the title, no spaces and end with md.

This is just normal text. This text is special, and this even more so. And what is this nice ‘highlight’?

creating a new paragraph: just add another enter.

To do lost:

  1. eat
  2. sleep
  3. die

Another list:

  • red
  • blue
  • yellow

Oh and this is interesting, said the older lady.

Footnotes?

Can we skip this lazy shit? > 56:03 Why is this guy repeating the same steps again and again?

crt+tab removes all the extra spaces in the mark up.

oh and that is a break

footnotes? This still shows upp

And this is done, bye!
entry.summary: Yay. Again the YAML frontmatter, that part between the 3 dashes that does not show up on the website itself, is a signal to jekkyl that you want this piece of code to be compiled to somehting on the website
